Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer made reviewable errors of fact or law in denying the Applicant's H&C application
Procedural_Stage: Judicial review in Federal Court following denial of H&C and PRRA applications
Evidence_Assessment: Officer ignored evidence of risk despite it being part of the original application
Legal_Rule: Officers must consider all relevant evidence, including risk factors, under the proper legal standard
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider all relevant information
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Violation of principle of considering all relevant information
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of H&C application based on factual errors and ignored evidence
Court_Result: Decision set aside; case remitted to a different officer for reconsideration
Outcome: Remitted for reassessment with all relevant evidence
Remedy_Sought: Allowance of judicial review and remittal
Claimant_Status: Applicant for permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness standard applies to questions of mixed fact and law in immigration decisions
